data.text: Interested in the latest country and regional policy advice from the IMF? Read #IMFCountryFocus at https://t.co/T5GY17yGK5 https://t.co/myKkDdIpvO

IMF Young economist Lin Li recommends “Booms and Depressions” by Irving Fisher, which inspired her to write the first chapter of her PhD thesis. This book taught her how important it was to fight deflation in the most recent global financial crisis. #BackToSchool https://t.co/QqHqMQry47

IMF research quantifies the macroeconomic benefits of lowering barriers to a #European capital market union: lower funding costs for firms, larger intra-EU portfolio capital flows, and more risk sharing https://t.co/PElfqRX642 #IMFBlog https://t.co/nqJZnhbtQP

Globally, the trade policy uncertainty index is rising sharply, having been stable at low levels for about 20 years. Read more on this new index https://t.co/T4l9i6l45p  #IMFBlog https://t.co/evusN8xoBC

#Mali is a fragile, low-income country facing a difficult security situation, impacting millions of Malians and weighing on economic activity and development prospects. https://t.co/Mg01J3r8r4 #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/qzs0ZQOIpm

Just out: end-2018 data on cross-border investment for 80+ economies. Updated twice a year with information by economy, currency, economic sector, and instrument to help policymakers analyze cross-border stocks of securities. Check out the latest data: https://t.co/RIxFPApdUd https://t.co/u0GJ3BH11x

Young Economist Philip Barrett just finished reading “Economics Evolving: A History of Economic Thought” by Agnar Sandmo. He recommends it as a #BackToSchool read because it is the history of #economics and how we got to the set of ideas that we use every day. https://t.co/Aa88XM4nxj

IMF Chief Economist Gita Gopinath will deliver keynote remarks at @CSIS on assessing global imbalances, followed by a panel discussion on the latest External Sector Report #ESR. Watch live on Sept 13 at 10:00am ET. https://t.co/FKOVMeqswF https://t.co/ky4H9P1aFN

At a joint conference, staff from the @OECD @WorldBank and IMF discussed the role of #PoliciesForGrowth in strengthening economic resilience. #StructuralReforms https://t.co/h48blBytIn https://t.co/VxvH7VMngL

On today's #BackToSchool series, IMF young economist @BounaderLahcen shares “Denationalisation of Money: The Argument Refined” by Nobel Laureate F.A. Hayek. With the surge of decentralized cryptocurrencies and FB’s Libra announcement, this book is of interest now more than ever. https://t.co/41pKcJaLdH

In our September issue of F&D on the hidden corners of the global economy, journalist Tom Mashberg explores the loosely regulated art market, which is rife with opportunities for washing illicit cash: https://t.co/rmJawpzpKD https://t.co/peR69X8bn7

Cash and bank deposits, the two most common forms of money today face tough competition and could even be surpassed by e-money. This paper looks at the rise of digital money and scenarios for the future: https://t.co/QnwX4zxJsI #fintech https://t.co/QmuA1lR5D5

Public spending on #education and #health is likely to be lower where #corruption is high, making it less likely that worker productivity and living standards will improve. https://t.co/Blae1mL63m https://t.co/qidYmMRg65

IMF Young Economist Hamid Tabarraei says he enjoyed reading “Straight Talk on Trade” by @rodrikdani because he explains why there is so much discontentment and anxiety with #globalization and #multilateralism. #BackToSchool https://t.co/btyxgeDjbo

In our #BackToSchool series, IMF young economists share the #books that are making a difference for them right now.
